00027 def _import_OrderedDict():
00028   import collections
00029   try:
00030     return collections.OrderedDict
00031   except AttributeError:
00032     import gyp.ordered_dict
00033     return gyp.ordered_dict.OrderedDict
00034 OrderedDict = _import_OrderedDict()

00037 # Regular expression for validating Visual Studio GUIDs.  If the GUID
00038 # contains lowercase hex letters, MSVS will be fine. However,
00039 # IncrediBuild BuildConsole will parse the solution file, but then
00040 # silently skip building the target causing hard to track down errors.
00041 # Note that this only happens with the BuildConsole, and does not occur
00042 # if IncrediBuild is executed from inside Visual Studio.  This regex
00043 # validates that the string looks like a GUID with all uppercase hex
00044 # letters.
00045 VALID_MSVS_GUID_CHARS = re.compile(r'^[A-F0-9\-]+$')

00099 cached_username = None
00100 
00101 
00102 cached_domain = None
00103 
00104 
00105 # TODO(gspencer): Switch the os.environ calls to be
00106 # win32api.GetDomainName() and win32api.GetUserName() once the
00107 # python version in depot_tools has been updated to work on Vista
00108 # 64-bit.
00109 def _GetDomainAndUserName():
00110   if sys.platform not in ('win32', 'cygwin'):
00111     return ('DOMAIN', 'USERNAME')
00112   global cached_username
00113   global cached_domain
00114   if not cached_domain or not cached_username:
00115     domain = os.environ.get('USERDOMAIN')
00116     username = os.environ.get('USERNAME')
00117     if not domain or not username:
00118       call = subprocess.Popen(['net', 'config', 'Workstation'],
00119                               stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
00120       config = call.communicate()[0]
00121       username_re = re.compile(r'^User name\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
00122       username_match = username_re.search(config)
00123       if username_match:
00124         username = username_match.group(1)
00125       domain_re = re.compile(r'^Logon domain\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
00126       domain_match = domain_re.search(config)
00127       if domain_match:
00128         domain = domain_match.group(1)
00129     cached_domain = domain
00130     cached_username = username
00131   return (cached_domain, cached_username)

00133 fixpath_prefix = None

00136 def _NormalizedSource(source):
00137   """Normalize the path.
00138 
00139   But not if that gets rid of a variable, as this may expand to something
00140   larger than one directory.
00141 
00142   Arguments:
00143       source: The path to be normalize.d
00144 
00145   Returns:
00146       The normalized path.
00147   """
00148   normalized = os.path.normpath(source)
00149   if source.count('$') == normalized.count('$'):
00150     source = normalized
00151   return source
00152 
00153 
00154 def _FixPath(path):
00155   """Convert paths to a form that will make sense in a vcproj file.
00156 
00157   Arguments:
00158     path: The path to convert, may contain / etc.
00159   Returns:
00160     The path with all slashes made into backslashes.
00161   """
00162   if fixpath_prefix and path and not os.path.isabs(path) and not path[0] == '$':
00163     path = os.path.join(fixpath_prefix, path)
00164   path = path.replace('/', '\\')
00165   path = _NormalizedSource(path)
00166   if path and path[-1] == '\\':
00167     path = path[:-1]
00168   return path
00169 
00170 
00171 def _FixPaths(paths):
00172   """Fix each of the paths of the list."""
00173   return [_FixPath(i) for i in paths]

00176 def _ConvertSourcesToFilterHierarchy(sources, prefix=None, excluded=None,
00177                                      list_excluded=True, msvs_version=None):
00178   """Converts a list split source file paths into a vcproj folder hierarchy.
00179 
00180   Arguments:
00181     sources: A list of source file paths split.
00182     prefix: A list of source file path layers meant to apply to each of sources.
00183     excluded: A set of excluded files.
00184     msvs_version: A MSVSVersion object.
00185 
00186   Returns:
00187     A hierarchy of filenames and MSVSProject.Filter objects that matches the
00188     layout of the source tree.
00189     For example:
00190     _ConvertSourcesToFilterHierarchy([['a', 'bob1.c'], ['b', 'bob2.c']],
00191                                      prefix=['joe'])
00192     -->
00193     [MSVSProject.Filter('a', contents=['joe\\a\\bob1.c']),
00194      MSVSProject.Filter('b', contents=['joe\\b\\bob2.c'])]
00195   """
00196   if not prefix: prefix = []
00197   result = []
00198   excluded_result = []
00199   folders = OrderedDict()
00200   # Gather files into the final result, excluded, or folders.
00201   for s in sources:
00202     if len(s) == 1:
00203       filename = _NormalizedSource('\\'.join(prefix + s))
00204       if filename in excluded:
00205         excluded_result.append(filename)
00206       else:
00207         result.append(filename)
00208     elif msvs_version and not msvs_version.UsesVcxproj():
00209       # For MSVS 2008 and earlier, we need to process all files before walking
00210       # the sub folders.
00211       if not folders.get(s[0]):
00212         folders[s[0]] = []
00213       folders[s[0]].append(s[1:])
00214     else:
00215       contents = _ConvertSourcesToFilterHierarchy([s[1:]], prefix + [s[0]],
00216                                                   excluded=excluded,
00217                                                   list_excluded=list_excluded,
00218                                                   msvs_version=msvs_version)
00219       contents = MSVSProject.Filter(s[0], contents=contents)
00220       result.append(contents)
00221   # Add a folder for excluded files.
00222   if excluded_result and list_excluded:
00223     excluded_folder = MSVSProject.Filter('_excluded_files',
00224                                          contents=excluded_result)
00225     result.append(excluded_folder)
00226 
00227   if msvs_version and msvs_version.UsesVcxproj():
00228     return result
00229 
00230   # Populate all the folders.
00231   for f in folders:
00232     contents = _ConvertSourcesToFilterHierarchy(folders[f], prefix=prefix + [f],
00233                                                 excluded=excluded,
00234                                                 list_excluded=list_excluded,
00235                                                 msvs_version=msvs_version)
00236     contents = MSVSProject.Filter(f, contents=contents)
00237     result.append(contents)
00238   return result

00241 def _ToolAppend(tools, tool_name, setting, value, only_if_unset=False):
00242   if not value: return
00243   _ToolSetOrAppend(tools, tool_name, setting, value, only_if_unset)
00244 
00245 
00246 def _ToolSetOrAppend(tools, tool_name, setting, value, only_if_unset=False):
00247   # TODO(bradnelson): ugly hack, fix this more generally!!!
00248   if 'Directories' in setting or 'Dependencies' in setting:
00249     if type(value) == str:
00250       value = value.replace('/', '\\')
00251     else:
00252       value = [i.replace('/', '\\') for i in value]
00253   if not tools.get(tool_name):
00254     tools[tool_name] = dict()
00255   tool = tools[tool_name]
00256   if tool.get(setting):
00257     if only_if_unset: return
00258     if type(tool[setting]) == list and type(value) == list:
00259       tool[setting] += value
00260     else:
00261       raise TypeError(
00262           'Appending "%s" to a non-list setting "%s" for tool "%s" is '
00263           'not allowed, previous value: %s' % (
00264               value, setting, tool_name, str(tool[setting])))
00265   else:
00266     tool[setting] = value

00273 def _ConfigBaseName(config_name, platform_name):
00274   if config_name.endswith('_' + platform_name):
00275     return config_name[0:-len(platform_name) - 1]
00276   else:
00277     return config_name

00279 
00280 def _ConfigFullName(config_name, config_data):
00281   platform_name = _ConfigPlatform(config_data)
00282   return '%s|%s' % (_ConfigBaseName(config_name, platform_name), platform_name)

00285 def _BuildCommandLineForRuleRaw(spec, cmd, cygwin_shell, has_input_path,
00286                                 quote_cmd, do_setup_env):
00287 
00288   if [x for x in cmd if '$(InputDir)' in x]:
00289     input_dir_preamble = (
00290       'set INPUTDIR=$(InputDir)\n'
00291       'if NOT DEFINED INPUTDIR set INPUTDIR=.\\\n'
00292       'set INPUTDIR=%INPUTDIR:~0,-1%\n'
00293       )
00294   else:
00295     input_dir_preamble = ''
00296 
00297   if cygwin_shell:
00298     # Find path to cygwin.
00299     cygwin_dir = _FixPath(spec.get('msvs_cygwin_dirs', ['.'])[0])
00300     # Prepare command.
00301     direct_cmd = cmd
00302     direct_cmd = [i.replace('$(IntDir)',
00303                             '`cygpath -m "${INTDIR}"`') for i in direct_cmd]
00304     direct_cmd = [i.replace('$(OutDir)',
00305                             '`cygpath -m "${OUTDIR}"`') for i in direct_cmd]
00306     direct_cmd = [i.replace('$(InputDir)',
00307                             '`cygpath -m "${INPUTDIR}"`') for i in direct_cmd]
00308     if has_input_path:
00309       direct_cmd = [i.replace('$(InputPath)',
00310                               '`cygpath -m "${INPUTPATH}"`')
00311                     for i in direct_cmd]
00312     direct_cmd = ['\\"%s\\"' % i.replace('"', '\\\\\\"') for i in direct_cmd]
00313     # direct_cmd = gyp.common.EncodePOSIXShellList(direct_cmd)
00314     direct_cmd = ' '.join(direct_cmd)
00315     # TODO(quote):  regularize quoting path names throughout the module
00316     cmd = ''
00317     if do_setup_env:
00318       cmd += 'call "$(ProjectDir)%(cygwin_dir)s\\setup_env.bat" && '
00319     cmd += 'set CYGWIN=nontsec&& '
00320     if direct_cmd.find('NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS') >= 0:
00321       cmd += 'set /a NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS_PLUS_1=%%NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS%%+1&& '
00322     if direct_cmd.find('INTDIR') >= 0:
00323       cmd += 'set INTDIR=$(IntDir)&& '
00324     if direct_cmd.find('OUTDIR') >= 0:
00325       cmd += 'set OUTDIR=$(OutDir)&& '
00326     if has_input_path and direct_cmd.find('INPUTPATH') >= 0:
00327       cmd += 'set INPUTPATH=$(InputPath) && '
00328     cmd += 'bash -c "%(cmd)s"'
00329     cmd = cmd % {'cygwin_dir': cygwin_dir,
00330                  'cmd': direct_cmd}
00331     return input_dir_preamble + cmd
00332   else:
00333     # Convert cat --> type to mimic unix.
00334     if cmd[0] == 'cat':
00335       command = ['type']
00336     else:
00337       command = [cmd[0].replace('/', '\\')]
00338     # Add call before command to ensure that commands can be tied together one
00339     # after the other without aborting in Incredibuild, since IB makes a bat
00340     # file out of the raw command string, and some commands (like python) are
00341     # actually batch files themselves.
00342     command.insert(0, 'call')
00343     # Fix the paths
00344     # TODO(quote): This is a really ugly heuristic, and will miss path fixing
00345     #              for arguments like "--arg=path" or "/opt:path".
00346     # If the argument starts with a slash or dash, it's probably a command line
00347     # switch
00348     arguments = [i if (i[:1] in "/-") else _FixPath(i) for i in cmd[1:]]
00349     arguments = [i.replace('$(InputDir)', '%INPUTDIR%') for i in arguments]
00350     arguments = [MSVSSettings.FixVCMacroSlashes(i) for i in arguments]
00351     if quote_cmd:
00352       # Support a mode for using cmd directly.
00353       # Convert any paths to native form (first element is used directly).
00354       # TODO(quote):  regularize quoting path names throughout the module
00355       arguments = ['"%s"' % i for i in arguments]
00356     # Collapse into a single command.
00357     return input_dir_preamble + ' '.join(command + arguments)
00358 
00359 
00360 def _BuildCommandLineForRule(spec, rule, has_input_path, do_setup_env):
00361   # Currently this weird argument munging is used to duplicate the way a
00362   # python script would need to be run as part of the chrome tree.
00363   # Eventually we should add some sort of rule_default option to set this
00364   # per project. For now the behavior chrome needs is the default.
00365   mcs = rule.get('msvs_cygwin_shell')
00366   if mcs is None:
00367     mcs = int(spec.get('msvs_cygwin_shell', 1))
00368   elif isinstance(mcs, str):
00369     mcs = int(mcs)
00370   quote_cmd = int(rule.get('msvs_quote_cmd', 1))
00371   return _BuildCommandLineForRuleRaw(spec, rule['action'], mcs, has_input_path,
00372                                      quote_cmd, do_setup_env=do_setup_env)

00374 
00375 def _AddActionStep(actions_dict, inputs, outputs, description, command):
00376   """Merge action into an existing list of actions.
00377 
00378   Care must be taken so that actions which have overlapping inputs either don't
00379   get assigned to the same input, or get collapsed into one.
00380 
00381   Arguments:
00382     actions_dict: dictionary keyed on input name, which maps to a list of
00383       dicts describing the actions attached to that input file.
00384     inputs: list of inputs
00385     outputs: list of outputs
00386     description: description of the action
00387     command: command line to execute
00388   """
00389   # Require there to be at least one input (call sites will ensure this).
00390   assert inputs
00391 
00392   action = {
00393       'inputs': inputs,
00394       'outputs': outputs,
00395       'description': description,
00396       'command': command,
00397   }
00398 
00399   # Pick where to stick this action.
00400   # While less than optimal in terms of build time, attach them to the first
00401   # input for now.
00402   chosen_input = inputs[0]
00403 
00404   # Add it there.
00405   if chosen_input not in actions_dict:
00406     actions_dict[chosen_input] = []
00407   actions_dict[chosen_input].append(action)
00408 
00409 
00410 def _AddCustomBuildToolForMSVS(p, spec, primary_input,
00411                                inputs, outputs, description, cmd):
00412   """Add a custom build tool to execute something.
00413 
00414   Arguments:
00415     p: the target project
00416     spec: the target project dict
00417     primary_input: input file to attach the build tool to
00418     inputs: list of inputs
00419     outputs: list of outputs
00420     description: description of the action
00421     cmd: command line to execute
00422   """
00423   inputs = _FixPaths(inputs)
00424   outputs = _FixPaths(outputs)
00425   tool = MSVSProject.Tool(
00426       'VCCustomBuildTool',
00427       {'Description': description,
00428        'AdditionalDependencies': ';'.join(inputs),
00429        'Outputs': ';'.join(outputs),
00430        'CommandLine': cmd,
00431       })
00432   # Add to the properties of primary input for each config.
00433   for config_name, c_data in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
00434     p.AddFileConfig(_FixPath(primary_input),
00435                     _ConfigFullName(config_name, c_data), tools=[tool])
00436 
00437 
00438 def _AddAccumulatedActionsToMSVS(p, spec, actions_dict):
00439   """Add actions accumulated into an actions_dict, merging as needed.
00440 
00441   Arguments:
00442     p: the target project
00443     spec: the target project dict
00444     actions_dict: dictionary keyed on input name, which maps to a list of
00445         dicts describing the actions attached to that input file.
00446   """
00447   for primary_input in actions_dict:
00448     inputs = OrderedSet()
00449     outputs = OrderedSet()
00450     descriptions = []
00451     commands = []
00452     for action in actions_dict[primary_input]:
00453       inputs.update(OrderedSet(action['inputs']))
00454       outputs.update(OrderedSet(action['outputs']))
00455       descriptions.append(action['description'])
00456       commands.append(action['command'])
00457     # Add the custom build step for one input file.
00458     description = ', and also '.join(descriptions)
00459     command = '\r\n'.join(commands)
00460     _AddCustomBuildToolForMSVS(p, spec,
00461                                primary_input=primary_input,
00462                                inputs=inputs,
00463                                outputs=outputs,
00464                                description=description,
00465                                cmd=command)
00466 
00467 
00468 def _RuleExpandPath(path, input_file):
00469   """Given the input file to which a rule applied, string substitute a path.
00470 
00471   Arguments:
00472     path: a path to string expand
00473     input_file: the file to which the rule applied.
00474   Returns:
00475     The string substituted path.
00476   """
00477   path = path.replace('$(InputName)',
00478                       os.path.splitext(os.path.split(input_file)[1])[0])
00479   path = path.replace('$(InputDir)', os.path.dirname(input_file))
00480   path = path.replace('$(InputExt)',
00481                       os.path.splitext(os.path.split(input_file)[1])[1])
00482   path = path.replace('$(InputFileName)', os.path.split(input_file)[1])
00483   path = path.replace('$(InputPath)', input_file)
00484   return path

00487 def _FindRuleTriggerFiles(rule, sources):
00488   """Find the list of files which a particular rule applies to.
00489 
00490   Arguments:
00491     rule: the rule in question
00492     sources: the set of all known source files for this project
00493   Returns:
00494     The list of sources that trigger a particular rule.
00495   """
00496   return rule.get('rule_sources', [])

00498 
00499 def _RuleInputsAndOutputs(rule, trigger_file):
00500   """Find the inputs and outputs generated by a rule.
00501 
00502   Arguments:
00503     rule: the rule in question.
00504     trigger_file: the main trigger for this rule.
00505   Returns:
00506     The pair of (inputs, outputs) involved in this rule.
00507   """
00508   raw_inputs = _FixPaths(rule.get('inputs', []))
00509   raw_outputs = _FixPaths(rule.get('outputs', []))
00510   inputs = OrderedSet()
00511   outputs = OrderedSet()
00512   inputs.add(trigger_file)
00513   for i in raw_inputs:
00514     inputs.add(_RuleExpandPath(i, trigger_file))
00515   for o in raw_outputs:
00516     outputs.add(_RuleExpandPath(o, trigger_file))
00517   return (inputs, outputs)
00518 
00519 
00520 def _GenerateNativeRulesForMSVS(p, rules, output_dir, spec, options):
00521   """Generate a native rules file.
00522 
00523   Arguments:
00524     p: the target project
00525     rules: the set of rules to include
00526     output_dir: the directory in which the project/gyp resides
00527     spec: the project dict
00528     options: global generator options
00529   """
00530   rules_filename = '%s%s.rules' % (spec['target_name'],
00531                                    options.suffix)
00532   rules_file = MSVSToolFile.Writer(os.path.join(output_dir, rules_filename),
00533                                    spec['target_name'])
00534   # Add each rule.
00535   for r in rules:
00536     rule_name = r['rule_name']
00537     rule_ext = r['extension']
00538     inputs = _FixPaths(r.get('inputs', []))
00539     outputs = _FixPaths(r.get('outputs', []))
00540     # Skip a rule with no action and no inputs.
00541     if 'action' not in r and not r.get('rule_sources', []):
00542       continue
00543     cmd = _BuildCommandLineForRule(spec, r, has_input_path=True,
00544                                    do_setup_env=True)
00545     rules_file.AddCustomBuildRule(name=rule_name,
00546                                   description=r.get('message', rule_name),
00547                                   extensions=[rule_ext],
00548                                   additional_dependencies=inputs,
00549                                   outputs=outputs,
00550                                   cmd=cmd)
00551   # Write out rules file.
00552   rules_file.WriteIfChanged()
00553 
00554   # Add rules file to project.
00555   p.AddToolFile(rules_filename)
00556 
00557 
00558 def _Cygwinify(path):
00559   path = path.replace('$(OutDir)', '$(OutDirCygwin)')
00560   path = path.replace('$(IntDir)', '$(IntDirCygwin)')
00561   return path

00563 
00564 def _GenerateExternalRules(rules, output_dir, spec,
00565                            sources, options, actions_to_add):
00566   """Generate an external makefile to do a set of rules.
00567 
00568   Arguments:
00569     rules: the list of rules to include
00570     output_dir: path containing project and gyp files
00571     spec: project specification data
00572     sources: set of sources known
00573     options: global generator options
00574     actions_to_add: The list of actions we will add to.
00575   """
00576   filename = '%s_rules%s.mk' % (spec['target_name'], options.suffix)
00577   mk_file = gyp.common.WriteOnDiff(os.path.join(output_dir, filename))
00578   # Find cygwin style versions of some paths.
00579   mk_file.write('OutDirCygwin:=$(shell cygpath -u "$(OutDir)")\n')
00580   mk_file.write('IntDirCygwin:=$(shell cygpath -u "$(IntDir)")\n')
00581   # Gather stuff needed to emit all: target.
00582   all_inputs = OrderedSet()
00583   all_outputs = OrderedSet()
00584   all_output_dirs = OrderedSet()
00585   first_outputs = []
00586   for rule in rules:
00587     trigger_files = _FindRuleTriggerFiles(rule, sources)
00588     for tf in trigger_files:
00589       inputs, outputs = _RuleInputsAndOutputs(rule, tf)
00590       all_inputs.update(OrderedSet(inputs))
00591       all_outputs.update(OrderedSet(outputs))
00592       # Only use one target from each rule as the dependency for
00593       # 'all' so we don't try to build each rule multiple times.
00594       first_outputs.append(list(outputs)[0])
00595       # Get the unique output directories for this rule.
00596       output_dirs = [os.path.split(i)[0] for i in outputs]
00597       for od in output_dirs:
00598         all_output_dirs.add(od)
00599   first_outputs_cyg = [_Cygwinify(i) for i in first_outputs]
00600   # Write out all: target, including mkdir for each output directory.
00601   mk_file.write('all: %s\n' % ' '.join(first_outputs_cyg))
00602   for od in all_output_dirs:
00603     if od:
00604       mk_file.write('\tmkdir -p `cygpath -u "%s"`\n' % od)
00605   mk_file.write('\n')
00606   # Define how each output is generated.
00607   for rule in rules:
00608     trigger_files = _FindRuleTriggerFiles(rule, sources)
00609     for tf in trigger_files:
00610       # Get all the inputs and outputs for this rule for this trigger file.
00611       inputs, outputs = _RuleInputsAndOutputs(rule, tf)
00612       inputs = [_Cygwinify(i) for i in inputs]
00613       outputs = [_Cygwinify(i) for i in outputs]
00614       # Prepare the command line for this rule.
00615       cmd = [_RuleExpandPath(c, tf) for c in rule['action']]
00616       cmd = ['"%s"' % i for i in cmd]
00617       cmd = ' '.join(cmd)
00618       # Add it to the makefile.
00619       mk_file.write('%s: %s\n' % (' '.join(outputs), ' '.join(inputs)))
00620       mk_file.write('\t%s\n\n' % cmd)
00621   # Close up the file.
00622   mk_file.close()
00623 
00624   # Add makefile to list of sources.
00625   sources.add(filename)
00626   # Add a build action to call makefile.
00627   cmd = ['make',
00628          'OutDir=$(OutDir)',
00629          'IntDir=$(IntDir)',
00630          '-j', '${NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS_PLUS_1}',
00631          '-f', filename]
00632   cmd = _BuildCommandLineForRuleRaw(spec, cmd, True, False, True, True)
00633   # Insert makefile as 0'th input, so it gets the action attached there,
00634   # as this is easier to understand from in the IDE.
00635   all_inputs = list(all_inputs)
00636   all_inputs.insert(0, filename)
00637   _AddActionStep(actions_to_add,
00638                  inputs=_FixPaths(all_inputs),
00639                  outputs=_FixPaths(all_outputs),
00640                  description='Running external rules for %s' %
00641                      spec['target_name'],
00642                  command=cmd)
00643 
00644 
00645 def _EscapeEnvironmentVariableExpansion(s):
00646   """Escapes % characters.
00647 
00648   Escapes any % characters so that Windows-style environment variable
00649   expansions will leave them alone.
00650   See http://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/106127/cl-d-name-text-containing-percentage-characters-doesnt-compile
00651   to understand why we have to do this.
00652 
00653   Args:
00654       s: The string to be escaped.
00655 
00656   Returns:
00657       The escaped string.
00658   """
00659   s = s.replace('%', '%%')
00660   return s
00661 
00662 
00663 quote_replacer_regex = re.compile(r'(\\*)"')
00664 
00665 
00666 def _EscapeCommandLineArgumentForMSVS(s):
00667   """Escapes a Windows command-line argument.
00668 
00669   So that the Win32 CommandLineToArgv function will turn the escaped result back
00670   into the original string.
00671   See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/17w5ykft.aspx
00672   ("Parsing C++ Command-Line Arguments") to understand why we have to do
00673   this.
00674 
00675   Args:
00676       s: the string to be escaped.
00677   Returns:
00678       the escaped string.
00679   """
00680 
00681   def _Replace(match):
00682     # For a literal quote, CommandLineToArgv requires an odd number of
00683     # backslashes preceding it, and it produces half as many literal backslashes
00684     # (rounded down). So we need to produce 2n+1 backslashes.
00685     return 2 * match.group(1) + '\\"'
00686 
00687   # Escape all quotes so that they are interpreted literally.
00688   s = quote_replacer_regex.sub(_Replace, s)
00689   # Now add unescaped quotes so that any whitespace is interpreted literally.
00690   s = '"' + s + '"'
00691   return s
00692 
00693 
00694 delimiters_replacer_regex = re.compile(r'(\\*)([,;]+)')
00695 
00696 
00697 def _EscapeVCProjCommandLineArgListItem(s):
00698   """Escapes command line arguments for MSVS.
00699 
00700   The VCProj format stores string lists in a single string using commas and
00701   semi-colons as separators, which must be quoted if they are to be
00702   interpreted literally. However, command-line arguments may already have
00703   quotes, and the VCProj parser is ignorant of the backslash escaping
00704   convention used by CommandLineToArgv, so the command-line quotes and the
00705   VCProj quotes may not be the same quotes. So to store a general
00706   command-line argument in a VCProj list, we need to parse the existing
00707   quoting according to VCProj's convention and quote any delimiters that are
00708   not already quoted by that convention. The quotes that we add will also be
00709   seen by CommandLineToArgv, so if backslashes precede them then we also have
00710   to escape those backslashes according to the CommandLineToArgv
00711   convention.
00712 
00713   Args:
00714       s: the string to be escaped.
00715   Returns:
00716       the escaped string.
00717   """
00718 
00719   def _Replace(match):
00720     # For a non-literal quote, CommandLineToArgv requires an even number of
00721     # backslashes preceding it, and it produces half as many literal
00722     # backslashes. So we need to produce 2n backslashes.
00723     return 2 * match.group(1) + '"' + match.group(2) + '"'
00724 
00725   segments = s.split('"')
00726   # The unquoted segments are at the even-numbered indices.
00727   for i in range(0, len(segments), 2):
00728     segments[i] = delimiters_replacer_regex.sub(_Replace, segments[i])
00729   # Concatenate back into a single string
00730   s = '"'.join(segments)
00731   if len(segments) % 2 == 0:
00732     # String ends while still quoted according to VCProj's convention. This
00733     # means the delimiter and the next list item that follow this one in the
00734     # .vcproj file will be misinterpreted as part of this item. There is nothing
00735     # we can do about this. Adding an extra quote would correct the problem in
00736     # the VCProj but cause the same problem on the final command-line. Moving
00737     # the item to the end of the list does works, but that's only possible if
00738     # there's only one such item. Let's just warn the user.
00739     print >> sys.stderr, ('Warning: MSVS may misinterpret the odd number of ' +
00740                           'quotes in ' + s)
00741   return s
00742 
00743 
00744 def _EscapeCppDefineForMSVS(s):
00745   """Escapes a CPP define so that it will reach the compiler unaltered."""
00746   s = _EscapeEnvironmentVariableExpansion(s)
00747   s = _EscapeCommandLineArgumentForMSVS(s)
00748   s = _EscapeVCProjCommandLineArgListItem(s)
00749   # cl.exe replaces literal # characters with = in preprocesor definitions for
00750   # some reason. Octal-encode to work around that.
00751   s = s.replace('#', '\\%03o' % ord('#'))
00752   return s
00753 
00754 
00755 quote_replacer_regex2 = re.compile(r'(\\+)"')
00756 
00757 
00758 def _EscapeCommandLineArgumentForMSBuild(s):
00759   """Escapes a Windows command-line argument for use by MSBuild."""
00760 
00761   def _Replace(match):
00762     return (len(match.group(1)) / 2 * 4) * '\\' + '\\"'
00763 
00764   # Escape all quotes so that they are interpreted literally.
00765   s = quote_replacer_regex2.sub(_Replace, s)
00766   return s
00767 
00768 
00769 def _EscapeMSBuildSpecialCharacters(s):
00770   escape_dictionary = {
00771       '%': '%25',
00772       '$': '%24',
00773       '@': '%40',
00774       "'": '%27',
00775       ';': '%3B',
00776       '?': '%3F',
00777       '*': '%2A'
00778       }
00779   result = ''.join([escape_dictionary.get(c, c) for c in s])
00780   return result
00781 
00782 
00783 def _EscapeCppDefineForMSBuild(s):
00784   """Escapes a CPP define so that it will reach the compiler unaltered."""
00785   s = _EscapeEnvironmentVariableExpansion(s)
00786   s = _EscapeCommandLineArgumentForMSBuild(s)
00787   s = _EscapeMSBuildSpecialCharacters(s)
00788   # cl.exe replaces literal # characters with = in preprocesor definitions for
00789   # some reason. Octal-encode to work around that.
00790   s = s.replace('#', '\\%03o' % ord('#'))
00791   return s
00792 
00793 
00794 def _GenerateRulesForMSVS(p, output_dir, options, spec,
00795                           sources, excluded_sources,
00796                           actions_to_add):
00797   """Generate all the rules for a particular project.
00798 
00799   Arguments:
00800     p: the project
00801     output_dir: directory to emit rules to
00802     options: global options passed to the generator
00803     spec: the specification for this project
00804     sources: the set of all known source files in this project
00805     excluded_sources: the set of sources excluded from normal processing
00806     actions_to_add: deferred list of actions to add in
00807   """
00808   rules = spec.get('rules', [])
00809   rules_native = [r for r in rules if not int(r.get('msvs_external_rule', 0))]
00810   rules_external = [r for r in rules if int(r.get('msvs_external_rule', 0))]
00811 
00812   # Handle rules that use a native rules file.
00813   if rules_native:
00814     _GenerateNativeRulesForMSVS(p, rules_native, output_dir, spec, options)
00815 
00816   # Handle external rules (non-native rules).
00817   if rules_external:
00818     _GenerateExternalRules(rules_external, output_dir, spec,
00819                            sources, options, actions_to_add)
00820   _AdjustSourcesForRules(rules, sources, excluded_sources, False)
00821 
00822 
00823 def _AdjustSourcesForRules(rules, sources, excluded_sources, is_msbuild):
00824   # Add outputs generated by each rule (if applicable).
00825   for rule in rules:
00826     # Add in the outputs from this rule.
00827     trigger_files = _FindRuleTriggerFiles(rule, sources)
00828     for trigger_file in trigger_files:
00829       # Remove trigger_file from excluded_sources to let the rule be triggered
00830       # (e.g. rule trigger ax_enums.idl is added to excluded_sources
00831       # because it's also in an action's inputs in the same project)
00832       excluded_sources.discard(_FixPath(trigger_file))
00833       # Done if not processing outputs as sources.
00834       if int(rule.get('process_outputs_as_sources', False)):
00835         inputs, outputs = _RuleInputsAndOutputs(rule, trigger_file)
00836         inputs = OrderedSet(_FixPaths(inputs))
00837         outputs = OrderedSet(_FixPaths(outputs))
00838         inputs.remove(_FixPath(trigger_file))
00839         sources.update(inputs)
00840         if not is_msbuild:
00841           excluded_sources.update(inputs)
00842         sources.update(outputs)
00843 
00844 
00845 def _FilterActionsFromExcluded(excluded_sources, actions_to_add):
00846   """Take inputs with actions attached out of the list of exclusions.
00847 
00848   Arguments:
00849     excluded_sources: list of source files not to be built.
00850     actions_to_add: dict of actions keyed on source file they're attached to.
00851   Returns:
00852     excluded_sources with files that have actions attached removed.
00853   """
00854   must_keep = OrderedSet(_FixPaths(actions_to_add.keys()))
00855   return [s for s in excluded_sources if s not in must_keep]
00856 
00857 
00858 def _GetDefaultConfiguration(spec):
00859   return spec['configurations'][spec['default_configuration']]
00860 
00861 
00862 def _GetGuidOfProject(proj_path, spec):
00863   """Get the guid for the project.
00864 
00865   Arguments:
00866     proj_path: Path of the vcproj or vcxproj file to generate.
00867     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
00868   Returns:
00869     the guid.
00870   Raises:
00871     ValueError: if the specified GUID is invalid.
00872   """
00873   # Pluck out the default configuration.
00874   default_config = _GetDefaultConfiguration(spec)
00875   # Decide the guid of the project.
00876   guid = default_config.get('msvs_guid')
00877   if guid:
00878     if VALID_MSVS_GUID_CHARS.match(guid) is None:
00879       raise ValueError('Invalid MSVS guid: "%s".  Must match regex: "%s".' %
00880                        (guid, VALID_MSVS_GUID_CHARS.pattern))
00881     guid = '{%s}' % guid
00882   guid = guid or MSVSNew.MakeGuid(proj_path)
00883   return guid
00884 
00885 
00886 def _GetMsbuildToolsetOfProject(proj_path, spec, version):
00887   """Get the platform toolset for the project.
00888 
00889   Arguments:
00890     proj_path: Path of the vcproj or vcxproj file to generate.
00891     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
00892     version: The MSVSVersion object.
00893   Returns:
00894     the platform toolset string or None.
00895   """
00896   # Pluck out the default configuration.
00897   default_config = _GetDefaultConfiguration(spec)
00898   toolset = default_config.get('msbuild_toolset')
00899   if not toolset and version.DefaultToolset():
00900     toolset = version.DefaultToolset()
00901   return toolset
00902 
00903 
00904 def _GenerateProject(project, options, version, generator_flags):
00905   """Generates a vcproj file.
00906 
00907   Arguments:
00908     project: the MSVSProject object.
00909     options: global generator options.
00910     version: the MSVSVersion object.
00911     generator_flags: dict of generator-specific flags.
00912   Returns:
00913     A list of source files that cannot be found on disk.
00914   """
00915   default_config = _GetDefaultConfiguration(project.spec)
00916 
00917   # Skip emitting anything if told to with msvs_existing_vcproj option.
00918   if default_config.get('msvs_existing_vcproj'):
00919     return []
00920 
00921   if version.UsesVcxproj():
00922     return _GenerateMSBuildProject(project, options, version, generator_flags)
00923   else:
00924     return _GenerateMSVSProject(project, options, version, generator_flags)
00925 
00926 
00927 # TODO: Avoid code duplication with _ValidateSourcesForOSX in make.py.
00928 def _ValidateSourcesForMSVSProject(spec, version):
00929   """Makes sure if duplicate basenames are not specified in the source list.
00930 
00931   Arguments:
00932     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
00933     version: The VisualStudioVersion object.
00934   """
00935   # This validation should not be applied to MSVC2010 and later.
00936   assert not version.UsesVcxproj()
00937 
00938   # TODO: Check if MSVC allows this for loadable_module targets.
00939   if spec.get('type', None) not in ('static_library', 'shared_library'):
00940     return
00941   sources = spec.get('sources', [])
00942   basenames = {}
00943   for source in sources:
00944     name, ext = os.path.splitext(source)
00945     is_compiled_file = ext in [
00946         '.c', '.cc', '.cpp', '.cxx', '.m', '.mm', '.s', '.S']
00947     if not is_compiled_file:
00948       continue
00949     basename = os.path.basename(name)  # Don't include extension.
00950     basenames.setdefault(basename, []).append(source)
00951 
00952   error = ''
00953   for basename, files in basenames.iteritems():
00954     if len(files) > 1:
00955       error += '  %s: %s\n' % (basename, ' '.join(files))
00956 
00957   if error:
00958     print('static library %s has several files with the same basename:\n' %
00959           spec['target_name'] + error + 'MSVC08 cannot handle that.')
00960     raise GypError('Duplicate basenames in sources section, see list above')
00961 
00962 
00963 def _GenerateMSVSProject(project, options, version, generator_flags):
00964   """Generates a .vcproj file.  It may create .rules and .user files too.
00965 
00966   Arguments:
00967     project: The project object we will generate the file for.
00968     options: Global options passed to the generator.
00969     version: The VisualStudioVersion object.
00970     generator_flags: dict of generator-specific flags.
00971   """
00972   spec = project.spec
00973   gyp.common.EnsureDirExists(project.path)
00974 
00975   platforms = _GetUniquePlatforms(spec)
00976   p = MSVSProject.Writer(project.path, version, spec['target_name'],
00977                          project.guid, platforms)
00978 
00979   # Get directory project file is in.
00980   project_dir = os.path.split(project.path)[0]
00981   gyp_path = _NormalizedSource(project.build_file)
00982   relative_path_of_gyp_file = gyp.common.RelativePath(gyp_path, project_dir)
00983 
00984   config_type = _GetMSVSConfigurationType(spec, project.build_file)
00985   for config_name, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
00986     _AddConfigurationToMSVSProject(p, spec, config_type, config_name, config)
00987 
00988   # MSVC08 and prior version cannot handle duplicate basenames in the same
00989   # target.
00990   # TODO: Take excluded sources into consideration if possible.
00991   _ValidateSourcesForMSVSProject(spec, version)
00992 
00993   # Prepare list of sources and excluded sources.
00994   gyp_file = os.path.split(project.build_file)[1]
00995   sources, excluded_sources = _PrepareListOfSources(spec, generator_flags,
00996                                                     gyp_file)
00997 
00998   # Add rules.
00999   actions_to_add = {}
01000   _GenerateRulesForMSVS(p, project_dir, options, spec,
01001                         sources, excluded_sources,
01002                         actions_to_add)
01003   list_excluded = generator_flags.get('msvs_list_excluded_files', True)
01004   sources, excluded_sources, excluded_idl = (
01005       _AdjustSourcesAndConvertToFilterHierarchy(spec, options, project_dir,
01006                                                 sources, excluded_sources,
01007                                                 list_excluded, version))
01008 
01009   # Add in files.
01010   missing_sources = _VerifySourcesExist(sources, project_dir)
01011   p.AddFiles(sources)
01012 
01013   _AddToolFilesToMSVS(p, spec)
01014   _HandlePreCompiledHeaders(p, sources, spec)
01015   _AddActions(actions_to_add, spec, relative_path_of_gyp_file)
01016   _AddCopies(actions_to_add, spec)
01017   _WriteMSVSUserFile(project.path, version, spec)
01018 
01019   # NOTE: this stanza must appear after all actions have been decided.
01020   # Don't excluded sources with actions attached, or they won't run.
01021   excluded_sources = _FilterActionsFromExcluded(
01022       excluded_sources, actions_to_add)
01023   _ExcludeFilesFromBeingBuilt(p, spec, excluded_sources, excluded_idl,
01024                               list_excluded)
01025   _AddAccumulatedActionsToMSVS(p, spec, actions_to_add)
01026 
01027   # Write it out.
01028   p.WriteIfChanged()
01029 
01030   return missing_sources
01031 
01032 
01033 def _GetUniquePlatforms(spec):
01034   """Returns the list of unique platforms for this spec, e.g ['win32', ...].
01035 
01036   Arguments:
01037     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01038   Returns:
01039     The MSVSUserFile object created.
01040   """
01041   # Gather list of unique platforms.
01042   platforms = OrderedSet()
01043   for configuration in spec['configurations']:
01044     platforms.add(_ConfigPlatform(spec['configurations'][configuration]))
01045   platforms = list(platforms)
01046   return platforms
01047 
01048 
01049 def _CreateMSVSUserFile(proj_path, version, spec):
01050   """Generates a .user file for the user running this Gyp program.
01051 
01052   Arguments:
01053     proj_path: The path of the project file being created.  The .user file
01054                shares the same path (with an appropriate suffix).
01055     version: The VisualStudioVersion object.
01056     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01057   Returns:
01058     The MSVSUserFile object created.
01059   """
01060   (domain, username) = _GetDomainAndUserName()
01061   vcuser_filename = '.'.join([proj_path, domain, username, 'user'])
01062   user_file = MSVSUserFile.Writer(vcuser_filename, version,
01063                                   spec['target_name'])
01064   return user_file
01065 
01066 
01067 def _GetMSVSConfigurationType(spec, build_file):
01068   """Returns the configuration type for this project.
01069 
01070   It's a number defined by Microsoft.  May raise an exception.
01071 
01072   Args:
01073       spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01074       build_file: The path of the gyp file.
01075   Returns:
01076       An integer, the configuration type.
01077   """
01078   try:
01079     config_type = {
01080         'executable': '1',  # .exe
01081         'shared_library': '2',  # .dll
01082         'loadable_module': '2',  # .dll
01083         'static_library': '4',  # .lib
01084         'none': '10',  # Utility type
01085         }[spec['type']]
01086   except KeyError:
01087     if spec.get('type'):
01088       raise GypError('Target type %s is not a valid target type for '
01089                      'target %s in %s.' %
01090                      (spec['type'], spec['target_name'], build_file))
01091     else:
01092       raise GypError('Missing type field for target %s in %s.' %
01093                      (spec['target_name'], build_file))
01094   return config_type
01095 
01096 
01097 def _AddConfigurationToMSVSProject(p, spec, config_type, config_name, config):
01098   """Adds a configuration to the MSVS project.
01099 
01100   Many settings in a vcproj file are specific to a configuration.  This
01101   function the main part of the vcproj file that's configuration specific.
01102 
01103   Arguments:
01104     p: The target project being generated.
01105     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01106     config_type: The configuration type, a number as defined by Microsoft.
01107     config_name: The name of the configuration.
01108     config: The dictionary that defines the special processing to be done
01109             for this configuration.
01110   """
01111   # Get the information for this configuration
01112   include_dirs, midl_include_dirs, resource_include_dirs = \
01113       _GetIncludeDirs(config)
01114   libraries = _GetLibraries(spec)
01115   library_dirs = _GetLibraryDirs(config)
01116   out_file, vc_tool, _ = _GetOutputFilePathAndTool(spec, msbuild=False)
01117   defines = _GetDefines(config)
01118   defines = [_EscapeCppDefineForMSVS(d) for d in defines]
01119   disabled_warnings = _GetDisabledWarnings(config)
01120   prebuild = config.get('msvs_prebuild')
01121   postbuild = config.get('msvs_postbuild')
01122   def_file = _GetModuleDefinition(spec)
01123   precompiled_header = config.get('msvs_precompiled_header')
01124 
01125   # Prepare the list of tools as a dictionary.
01126   tools = dict()
01127   # Add in user specified msvs_settings.
01128   msvs_settings = config.get('msvs_settings', {})
01129   MSVSSettings.ValidateMSVSSettings(msvs_settings)
01130 
01131   # Prevent default library inheritance from the environment.
01132   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCLinkerTool', 'AdditionalDependencies', ['$(NOINHERIT)'])
01133 
01134   for tool in msvs_settings:
01135     settings = config['msvs_settings'][tool]
01136     for setting in settings:
01137       _ToolAppend(tools, tool, setting, settings[setting])
01138   # Add the information to the appropriate tool
01139   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool',
01140               'AdditionalIncludeDirectories', include_dirs)
01141   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCMIDLTool',
01142               'AdditionalIncludeDirectories', midl_include_dirs)
01143   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCResourceCompilerTool',
01144               'AdditionalIncludeDirectories', resource_include_dirs)
01145   # Add in libraries.
01146   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCLinkerTool', 'AdditionalDependencies', libraries)
01147   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCLinkerTool', 'AdditionalLibraryDirectories',
01148               library_dirs)
01149   if out_file:
01150     _ToolAppend(tools, vc_tool, 'OutputFile', out_file, only_if_unset=True)
01151   # Add defines.
01152   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool', 'PreprocessorDefinitions', defines)
01153   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCResourceCompilerTool', 'PreprocessorDefinitions',
01154               defines)
01155   # Change program database directory to prevent collisions.
01156   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool', 'ProgramDataBaseFileName',
01157               '$(IntDir)$(ProjectName)\\vc80.pdb', only_if_unset=True)
01158   # Add disabled warnings.
01159   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool',
01160               'DisableSpecificWarnings', disabled_warnings)
01161   # Add Pre-build.
01162   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCPreBuildEventTool', 'CommandLine', prebuild)
01163   # Add Post-build.
01164   _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCPostBuildEventTool', 'CommandLine', postbuild)
01165   # Turn on precompiled headers if appropriate.
01166   if precompiled_header:
01167     precompiled_header = os.path.split(precompiled_header)[1]
01168     _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool', 'UsePrecompiledHeader', '2')
01169     _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool',
01170                 'PrecompiledHeaderThrough', precompiled_header)
01171     _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCCLCompilerTool',
01172                 'ForcedIncludeFiles', precompiled_header)
01173   # Loadable modules don't generate import libraries;
01174   # tell dependent projects to not expect one.
01175   if spec['type'] == 'loadable_module':
01176     _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCLinkerTool', 'IgnoreImportLibrary', 'true')
01177   # Set the module definition file if any.
01178   if def_file:
01179     _ToolAppend(tools, 'VCLinkerTool', 'ModuleDefinitionFile', def_file)
01180 
01181   _AddConfigurationToMSVS(p, spec, tools, config, config_type, config_name)
01182 
01183 
01184 def _GetIncludeDirs(config):
01185   """Returns the list of directories to be used for #include directives.
01186 
01187   Arguments:
01188     config: The dictionary that defines the special processing to be done
01189             for this configuration.
01190   Returns:
01191     The list of directory paths.
01192   """
01193   # TODO(bradnelson): include_dirs should really be flexible enough not to
01194   #                   require this sort of thing.
01195   include_dirs = (
01196       config.get('include_dirs', []) +
01197       config.get('msvs_system_include_dirs', []))
01198   midl_include_dirs = (
01199       config.get('midl_include_dirs', []) +
01200       config.get('msvs_system_include_dirs', []))
01201   resource_include_dirs = config.get('resource_include_dirs', include_dirs)
01202   include_dirs = _FixPaths(include_dirs)
01203   midl_include_dirs = _FixPaths(midl_include_dirs)
01204   resource_include_dirs = _FixPaths(resource_include_dirs)
01205   return include_dirs, midl_include_dirs, resource_include_dirs
01206 
01207 
01208 def _GetLibraryDirs(config):
01209   """Returns the list of directories to be used for library search paths.
01210 
01211   Arguments:
01212     config: The dictionary that defines the special processing to be done
01213             for this configuration.
01214   Returns:
01215     The list of directory paths.
01216   """
01217 
01218   library_dirs = config.get('library_dirs', [])
01219   library_dirs = _FixPaths(library_dirs)
01220   return library_dirs
01221 
01222 
01223 def _GetLibraries(spec):
01224   """Returns the list of libraries for this configuration.
01225 
01226   Arguments:
01227     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01228   Returns:
01229     The list of directory paths.
01230   """
01231   libraries = spec.get('libraries', [])
01232   # Strip out -l, as it is not used on windows (but is needed so we can pass
01233   # in libraries that are assumed to be in the default library path).
01234   # Also remove duplicate entries, leaving only the last duplicate, while
01235   # preserving order.
01236   found = OrderedSet()
01237   unique_libraries_list = []
01238   for entry in reversed(libraries):
01239     library = re.sub(r'^\-l', '', entry)
01240     if not os.path.splitext(library)[1]:
01241       library += '.lib'
01242     if library not in found:
01243       found.add(library)
01244       unique_libraries_list.append(library)
01245   unique_libraries_list.reverse()
01246   return unique_libraries_list
01247 
01248 
01249 def _GetOutputFilePathAndTool(spec, msbuild):
01250   """Returns the path and tool to use for this target.
01251 
01252   Figures out the path of the file this spec will create and the name of
01253   the VC tool that will create it.
01254 
01255   Arguments:
01256     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01257   Returns:
01258     A triple of (file path, name of the vc tool, name of the msbuild tool)
01259   """
01260   # Select a name for the output file.
01261   out_file = ''
01262   vc_tool = ''
01263   msbuild_tool = ''
01264   output_file_map = {
01265       'executable': ('VCLinkerTool', 'Link', '$(OutDir)', '.exe'),
01266       'shared_library': ('VCLinkerTool', 'Link', '$(OutDir)', '.dll'),
01267       'loadable_module': ('VCLinkerTool', 'Link', '$(OutDir)', '.dll'),
01268       'static_library': ('VCLibrarianTool', 'Lib', '$(OutDir)lib\\', '.lib'),
01269   }
01270   output_file_props = output_file_map.get(spec['type'])
01271   if output_file_props and int(spec.get('msvs_auto_output_file', 1)):
01272     vc_tool, msbuild_tool, out_dir, suffix = output_file_props
01273     if spec.get('standalone_static_library', 0):
01274       out_dir = '$(OutDir)'
01275     out_dir = spec.get('product_dir', out_dir)
01276     product_extension = spec.get('product_extension')
01277     if product_extension:
01278       suffix = '.' + product_extension
01279     elif msbuild:
01280       suffix = '$(TargetExt)'
01281     prefix = spec.get('product_prefix', '')
01282     product_name = spec.get('product_name', '$(ProjectName)')
01283     out_file = ntpath.join(out_dir, prefix + product_name + suffix)
01284   return out_file, vc_tool, msbuild_tool
01285 
01286 
01287 def _GetOutputTargetExt(spec):
01288   """Returns the extension for this target, including the dot
01289 
01290   If product_extension is specified, set target_extension to this to avoid
01291   MSB8012, returns None otherwise. Ignores any target_extension settings in
01292   the input files.
01293 
01294   Arguments:
01295     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01296   Returns:
01297     A string with the extension, or None
01298   """
01299   target_extension = spec.get('product_extension')
01300   if target_extension:
01301     return '.' + target_extension
01302   return None
01303 
01304 
01305 def _GetDefines(config):
01306   """Returns the list of preprocessor definitions for this configuation.
01307 
01308   Arguments:
01309     config: The dictionary that defines the special processing to be done
01310             for this configuration.
01311   Returns:
01312     The list of preprocessor definitions.
01313   """
01314   defines = []
01315   for d in config.get('defines', []):
01316     if type(d) == list:
01317       fd = '='.join([str(dpart) for dpart in d])
01318     else:
01319       fd = str(d)
01320     defines.append(fd)
01321   return defines
01322 
01323 
01324 def _GetDisabledWarnings(config):
01325   return [str(i) for i in config.get('msvs_disabled_warnings', [])]
01326 
01327 
01328 def _GetModuleDefinition(spec):
01329   def_file = ''
01330   if spec['type'] in ['shared_library', 'loadable_module', 'executable']:
01331     def_files = [s for s in spec.get('sources', []) if s.endswith('.def')]
01332     if len(def_files) == 1:
01333       def_file = _FixPath(def_files[0])
01334     elif def_files:
01335       raise ValueError(
01336           'Multiple module definition files in one target, target %s lists '
01337           'multiple .def files: %s' % (
01338               spec['target_name'], ' '.join(def_files)))
01339   return def_file
01340 
01341 
01342 def _ConvertToolsToExpectedForm(tools):
01343   """Convert tools to a form expected by Visual Studio.
01344 
01345   Arguments:
01346     tools: A dictionary of settings; the tool name is the key.
01347   Returns:
01348     A list of Tool objects.
01349   """
01350   tool_list = []
01351   for tool, settings in tools.iteritems():
01352     # Collapse settings with lists.
01353     settings_fixed = {}
01354     for setting, value in settings.iteritems():
01355       if type(value) == list:
01356         if ((tool == 'VCLinkerTool' and
01357              setting == 'AdditionalDependencies') or
01358             setting == 'AdditionalOptions'):
01359           settings_fixed[setting] = ' '.join(value)
01360         else:
01361           settings_fixed[setting] = ';'.join(value)
01362       else:
01363         settings_fixed[setting] = value
01364     # Add in this tool.
01365     tool_list.append(MSVSProject.Tool(tool, settings_fixed))
01366   return tool_list
01367 
01368 
01369 def _AddConfigurationToMSVS(p, spec, tools, config, config_type, config_name):
01370   """Add to the project file the configuration specified by config.
01371 
01372   Arguments:
01373     p: The target project being generated.
01374     spec: the target project dict.
01375     tools: A dictionary of settings; the tool name is the key.
01376     config: The dictionary that defines the special processing to be done
01377             for this configuration.
01378     config_type: The configuration type, a number as defined by Microsoft.
01379     config_name: The name of the configuration.
01380   """
01381   attributes = _GetMSVSAttributes(spec, config, config_type)
01382   # Add in this configuration.
01383   tool_list = _ConvertToolsToExpectedForm(tools)
01384   p.AddConfig(_ConfigFullName(config_name, config),
01385               attrs=attributes, tools=tool_list)
01386 
01387 
01388 def _GetMSVSAttributes(spec, config, config_type):
01389   # Prepare configuration attributes.
01390   prepared_attrs = {}
01391   source_attrs = config.get('msvs_configuration_attributes', {})
01392   for a in source_attrs:
01393     prepared_attrs[a] = source_attrs[a]
01394   # Add props files.
01395   vsprops_dirs = config.get('msvs_props', [])
01396   vsprops_dirs = _FixPaths(vsprops_dirs)
01397   if vsprops_dirs:
01398     prepared_attrs['InheritedPropertySheets'] = ';'.join(vsprops_dirs)
01399   # Set configuration type.
01400   prepared_attrs['ConfigurationType'] = config_type
01401   output_dir = prepared_attrs.get('OutputDirectory',
01402                                   '$(SolutionDir)$(ConfigurationName)')
01403   prepared_attrs['OutputDirectory'] = _FixPath(output_dir) + '\\'
01404   if 'IntermediateDirectory' not in prepared_attrs:
01405     intermediate = '$(ConfigurationName)\\obj\\$(ProjectName)'
01406     prepared_attrs['IntermediateDirectory'] = _FixPath(intermediate) + '\\'
01407   else:
01408     intermediate = _FixPath(prepared_attrs['IntermediateDirectory']) + '\\'
01409     intermediate = MSVSSettings.FixVCMacroSlashes(intermediate)
01410     prepared_attrs['IntermediateDirectory'] = intermediate
01411   return prepared_attrs
01412 
01413 
01414 def _AddNormalizedSources(sources_set, sources_array):
01415   sources_set.update(_NormalizedSource(s) for s in sources_array)
01416 
01417 
01418 def _PrepareListOfSources(spec, generator_flags, gyp_file):
01419   """Prepare list of sources and excluded sources.
01420 
01421   Besides the sources specified directly in the spec, adds the gyp file so
01422   that a change to it will cause a re-compile. Also adds appropriate sources
01423   for actions and copies. Assumes later stage will un-exclude files which
01424   have custom build steps attached.
01425 
01426   Arguments:
01427     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01428     gyp_file: The name of the gyp file.
01429   Returns:
01430     A pair of (list of sources, list of excluded sources).
01431     The sources will be relative to the gyp file.
01432   """
01433   sources = OrderedSet()
01434   _AddNormalizedSources(sources, spec.get('sources', []))
01435   excluded_sources = OrderedSet()
01436   # Add in the gyp file.
01437   if not generator_flags.get('standalone'):
01438     sources.add(gyp_file)
01439 
01440   # Add in 'action' inputs and outputs.
01441   for a in spec.get('actions', []):
01442     inputs = a['inputs']
01443     inputs = [_NormalizedSource(i) for i in inputs]
01444     # Add all inputs to sources and excluded sources.
01445     inputs = OrderedSet(inputs)
01446     sources.update(inputs)
01447     if not spec.get('msvs_external_builder'):
01448       excluded_sources.update(inputs)
01449     if int(a.get('process_outputs_as_sources', False)):
01450       _AddNormalizedSources(sources, a.get('outputs', []))
01451   # Add in 'copies' inputs and outputs.
01452   for cpy in spec.get('copies', []):
01453     _AddNormalizedSources(sources, cpy.get('files', []))
01454   return (sources, excluded_sources)
01455 
01456 
01457 def _AdjustSourcesAndConvertToFilterHierarchy(
01458     spec, options, gyp_dir, sources, excluded_sources, list_excluded, version):
01459   """Adjusts the list of sources and excluded sources.
01460 
01461   Also converts the sets to lists.
01462 
01463   Arguments:
01464     spec: The target dictionary containing the properties of the target.
01465     options: Global generator options.
01466     gyp_dir: The path to the gyp file being processed.
01467     sources: A set of sources to be included for this project.
01468     excluded_sources: A set of sources to be excluded for this project.
01469     version: A MSVSVersion object.
01470   Returns:
01471     A trio of (list of sources, list of excluded sources,
01472                path of excluded IDL file)
01473   """
01474   # Exclude excluded sources coming into the generator.
01475   excluded_sources.update(OrderedSet(spec.get('sources_excluded', [])))
01476   # Add excluded sources into sources for good measure.
01477   sources.update(excluded_sources)
01478   # Convert to proper windows form.
01479   # NOTE: sources goes from being a set to a list here.
01480   # NOTE: excluded_sources goes from being a set to a list here.
01481   sources = _FixPaths(sources)
01482   # Convert to proper windows form.
01483   excluded_sources = _FixPaths(excluded_sources)
01484 
01485   excluded_idl = _IdlFilesHandledNonNatively(spec, sources)
01486 
01487   precompiled_related = _GetPrecompileRelatedFiles(spec)
01488   # Find the excluded ones, minus the precompiled header related ones.
01489   fully_excluded = [i for i in excluded_sources if i not in precompiled_related]
01490 
01491   # Convert to folders and the right slashes.
01492   sources = [i.split('\\') for i in sources]
01493   sources = _ConvertSourcesToFilterHierarchy(sources, excluded=fully_excluded,
01494                                              list_excluded=list_excluded,
01495                                              msvs_version=version)
01496 
01497   # Prune filters with a single child to flatten ugly directory structures
01498   # such as ../../src/modules/module1 etc.
01499   if version.UsesVcxproj():
01500     while all([isinstance(s, MSVSProject.Filter) for s in sources]) \
01501         and len(set([s.name for s in sources])) == 1:
01502       assert all([len(s.contents) == 1 for s in sources])
01503       sources = [s.contents[0] for s in sources]
01504   else:
01505     while len(sources) == 1 and isinstance(sources[0], MSVSProject.Filter):
01506       sources = sources[0].contents
01507 
01508   return sources, excluded_sources, excluded_idl
01509 
01510 
01511 def _IdlFilesHandledNonNatively(spec, sources):
01512   # If any non-native rules use 'idl' as an extension exclude idl files.
01513   # Gather a list here to use later.
01514   using_idl = False
01515   for rule in spec.get('rules', []):
01516     if rule['extension'] == 'idl' and int(rule.get('msvs_external_rule', 0)):
01517       using_idl = True
01518       break
01519   if using_idl:
01520     excluded_idl = [i for i in sources if i.endswith('.idl')]
01521   else:
01522     excluded_idl = []
01523   return excluded_idl
01524 
01525 
01526 def _GetPrecompileRelatedFiles(spec):
01527   # Gather a list of precompiled header related sources.
01528   precompiled_related = []
01529   for _, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01530     for k in precomp_keys:
01531       f = config.get(k)
01532       if f:
01533         precompiled_related.append(_FixPath(f))
01534   return precompiled_related
01535 
01536 
01537 def _ExcludeFilesFromBeingBuilt(p, spec, excluded_sources, excluded_idl,
01538                                 list_excluded):
01539   exclusions = _GetExcludedFilesFromBuild(spec, excluded_sources, excluded_idl)
01540   for file_name, excluded_configs in exclusions.iteritems():
01541     if (not list_excluded and
01542             len(excluded_configs) == len(spec['configurations'])):
01543       # If we're not listing excluded files, then they won't appear in the
01544       # project, so don't try to configure them to be excluded.
01545       pass
01546     else:
01547       for config_name, config in excluded_configs:
01548         p.AddFileConfig(file_name, _ConfigFullName(config_name, config),
01549                         {'ExcludedFromBuild': 'true'})
01550 
01551 
01552 def _GetExcludedFilesFromBuild(spec, excluded_sources, excluded_idl):
01553   exclusions = {}
01554   # Exclude excluded sources from being built.
01555   for f in excluded_sources:
01556     excluded_configs = []
01557     for config_name, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01558       precomped = [_FixPath(config.get(i, '')) for i in precomp_keys]
01559       # Don't do this for ones that are precompiled header related.
01560       if f not in precomped:
01561         excluded_configs.append((config_name, config))
01562     exclusions[f] = excluded_configs
01563   # If any non-native rules use 'idl' as an extension exclude idl files.
01564   # Exclude them now.
01565   for f in excluded_idl:
01566     excluded_configs = []
01567     for config_name, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01568       excluded_configs.append((config_name, config))
01569     exclusions[f] = excluded_configs
01570   return exclusions
01571 
01572 
01573 def _AddToolFilesToMSVS(p, spec):
01574   # Add in tool files (rules).
01575   tool_files = OrderedSet()
01576   for _, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01577     for f in config.get('msvs_tool_files', []):
01578       tool_files.add(f)
01579   for f in tool_files:
01580     p.AddToolFile(f)
01581 
01582 
01583 def _HandlePreCompiledHeaders(p, sources, spec):
01584   # Pre-compiled header source stubs need a different compiler flag
01585   # (generate precompiled header) and any source file not of the same
01586   # kind (i.e. C vs. C++) as the precompiled header source stub needs
01587   # to have use of precompiled headers disabled.
01588   extensions_excluded_from_precompile = []
01589   for config_name, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01590     source = config.get('msvs_precompiled_source')
01591     if source:
01592       source = _FixPath(source)
01593       # UsePrecompiledHeader=1 for if using precompiled headers.
01594       tool = MSVSProject.Tool('VCCLCompilerTool',
01595                               {'UsePrecompiledHeader': '1'})
01596       p.AddFileConfig(source, _ConfigFullName(config_name, config),
01597                       {}, tools=[tool])
01598       basename, extension = os.path.splitext(source)
01599       if extension == '.c':
01600         extensions_excluded_from_precompile = ['.cc', '.cpp', '.cxx']
01601       else:
01602         extensions_excluded_from_precompile = ['.c']
01603   def DisableForSourceTree(source_tree):
01604     for source in source_tree:
01605       if isinstance(source, MSVSProject.Filter):
01606         DisableForSourceTree(source.contents)
01607       else:
01608         basename, extension = os.path.splitext(source)
01609         if extension in extensions_excluded_from_precompile:
01610           for config_name, config in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01611             tool = MSVSProject.Tool('VCCLCompilerTool',
01612                                     {'UsePrecompiledHeader': '0',
01613                                      'ForcedIncludeFiles': '$(NOINHERIT)'})
01614             p.AddFileConfig(_FixPath(source),
01615                             _ConfigFullName(config_name, config),
01616                             {}, tools=[tool])
01617   # Do nothing if there was no precompiled source.
01618   if extensions_excluded_from_precompile:
01619     DisableForSourceTree(sources)
01620 
01621 
01622 def _AddActions(actions_to_add, spec, relative_path_of_gyp_file):
01623   # Add actions.
01624   actions = spec.get('actions', [])
01625   # Don't setup_env every time. When all the actions are run together in one
01626   # batch file in VS, the PATH will grow too long.
01627   # Membership in this set means that the cygwin environment has been set up,
01628   # and does not need to be set up again.
01629   have_setup_env = set()
01630   for a in actions:
01631     # Attach actions to the gyp file if nothing else is there.
01632     inputs = a.get('inputs') or [relative_path_of_gyp_file]
01633     attached_to = inputs[0]
01634     need_setup_env = attached_to not in have_setup_env
01635     cmd = _BuildCommandLineForRule(spec, a, has_input_path=False,
01636                                    do_setup_env=need_setup_env)
01637     have_setup_env.add(attached_to)
01638     # Add the action.
01639     _AddActionStep(actions_to_add,
01640                    inputs=inputs,
01641                    outputs=a.get('outputs', []),
01642                    description=a.get('message', a['action_name']),
01643                    command=cmd)
01644 
01645 
01646 def _WriteMSVSUserFile(project_path, version, spec):
01647   # Add run_as and test targets.
01648   if 'run_as' in spec:
01649     run_as = spec['run_as']
01650     action = run_as.get('action', [])
01651     environment = run_as.get('environment', [])
01652     working_directory = run_as.get('working_directory', '.')
01653   elif int(spec.get('test', 0)):
01654     action = ['$(TargetPath)', '--gtest_print_time']
01655     environment = []
01656     working_directory = '.'
01657   else:
01658     return  # Nothing to add
01659   # Write out the user file.
01660   user_file = _CreateMSVSUserFile(project_path, version, spec)
01661   for config_name, c_data in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01662     user_file.AddDebugSettings(_ConfigFullName(config_name, c_data),
01663                                action, environment, working_directory)
01664   user_file.WriteIfChanged()
01665 
01666 
01667 def _AddCopies(actions_to_add, spec):
01668   copies = _GetCopies(spec)
01669   for inputs, outputs, cmd, description in copies:
01670     _AddActionStep(actions_to_add, inputs=inputs, outputs=outputs,
01671                    description=description, command=cmd)
01672 
01673 
01674 def _GetCopies(spec):
01675   copies = []
01676   # Add copies.
01677   for cpy in spec.get('copies', []):
01678     for src in cpy.get('files', []):
01679       dst = os.path.join(cpy['destination'], os.path.basename(src))
01680       # _AddCustomBuildToolForMSVS() will call _FixPath() on the inputs and
01681       # outputs, so do the same for our generated command line.
01682       if src.endswith('/'):
01683         src_bare = src[:-1]
01684         base_dir = posixpath.split(src_bare)[0]
01685         outer_dir = posixpath.split(src_bare)[1]
01686         cmd = 'cd "%s" && xcopy /e /f /y "%s" "%s\\%s\\"' % (
01687             _FixPath(base_dir), outer_dir, _FixPath(dst), outer_dir)
01688         copies.append(([src], ['dummy_copies', dst], cmd,
01689                        'Copying %s to %s' % (src, dst)))
01690       else:
01691         cmd = 'mkdir "%s" 2>nul & set ERRORLEVEL=0 & copy /Y "%s" "%s"' % (
01692             _FixPath(cpy['destination']), _FixPath(src), _FixPath(dst))
01693         copies.append(([src], [dst], cmd, 'Copying %s to %s' % (src, dst)))
01694   return copies
01695 
01696 
01697 def _GetPathDict(root, path):
01698   # |path| will eventually be empty (in the recursive calls) if it was initially
01699   # relative; otherwise it will eventually end up as '\', 'D:\', etc.
01700   if not path or path.endswith(os.sep):
01701     return root
01702   parent, folder = os.path.split(path)
01703   parent_dict = _GetPathDict(root, parent)
01704   if folder not in parent_dict:
01705     parent_dict[folder] = dict()
01706   return parent_dict[folder]
01707 
01708 
01709 def _DictsToFolders(base_path, bucket, flat):
01710   # Convert to folders recursively.
01711   children = []
01712   for folder, contents in bucket.iteritems():
01713     if type(contents) == dict:
01714       folder_children = _DictsToFolders(os.path.join(base_path, folder),
01715                                         contents, flat)
01716       if flat:
01717         children += folder_children
01718       else:
01719         folder_children = MSVSNew.MSVSFolder(os.path.join(base_path, folder),
01720                                              name='(' + folder + ')',
01721                                              entries=folder_children)
01722         children.append(folder_children)
01723     else:
01724       children.append(contents)
01725   return children
01726 
01727 
01728 def _CollapseSingles(parent, node):
01729   # Recursively explorer the tree of dicts looking for projects which are
01730   # the sole item in a folder which has the same name as the project. Bring
01731   # such projects up one level.
01732   if (type(node) == dict and
01733       len(node) == 1 and
01734       node.keys()[0] == parent + '.vcproj'):
01735     return node[node.keys()[0]]
01736   if type(node) != dict:
01737     return node
01738   for child in node:
01739     node[child] = _CollapseSingles(child, node[child])
01740   return node
01741 
01742 
01743 def _GatherSolutionFolders(sln_projects, project_objects, flat):
01744   root = {}
01745   # Convert into a tree of dicts on path.
01746   for p in sln_projects:
01747     gyp_file, target = gyp.common.ParseQualifiedTarget(p)[0:2]
01748     gyp_dir = os.path.dirname(gyp_file)
01749     path_dict = _GetPathDict(root, gyp_dir)
01750     path_dict[target + '.vcproj'] = project_objects[p]
01751   # Walk down from the top until we hit a folder that has more than one entry.
01752   # In practice, this strips the top-level "src/" dir from the hierarchy in
01753   # the solution.
01754   while len(root) == 1 and type(root[root.keys()[0]]) == dict:
01755     root = root[root.keys()[0]]
01756   # Collapse singles.
01757   root = _CollapseSingles('', root)
01758   # Merge buckets until everything is a root entry.
01759   return _DictsToFolders('', root, flat)
01760 
01761 
01762 def _GetPathOfProject(qualified_target, spec, options, msvs_version):
01763   default_config = _GetDefaultConfiguration(spec)
01764   proj_filename = default_config.get('msvs_existing_vcproj')
01765   if not proj_filename:
01766     proj_filename = (spec['target_name'] + options.suffix +
01767                      msvs_version.ProjectExtension())
01768 
01769   build_file = gyp.common.BuildFile(qualified_target)
01770   proj_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(build_file), proj_filename)
01771   fix_prefix = None
01772   if options.generator_output:
01773     project_dir_path = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(proj_path))
01774     proj_path = os.path.join(options.generator_output, proj_path)
01775     fix_prefix = gyp.common.RelativePath(project_dir_path,
01776                                          os.path.dirname(proj_path))
01777   return proj_path, fix_prefix
01778 
01779 
01780 def _GetPlatformOverridesOfProject(spec):
01781   # Prepare a dict indicating which project configurations are used for which
01782   # solution configurations for this target.
01783   config_platform_overrides = {}
01784   for config_name, c in spec['configurations'].iteritems():
01785     config_fullname = _ConfigFullName(config_name, c)
01786     platform = c.get('msvs_target_platform', _ConfigPlatform(c))
01787     fixed_config_fullname = '%s|%s' % (
01788         _ConfigBaseName(config_name, _ConfigPlatform(c)), platform)
01789     config_platform_overrides[config_fullname] = fixed_config_fullname
01790   return config_platform_overrides
01791 
01792 
01793 def _CreateProjectObjects(target_list, target_dicts, options, msvs_version):
01794   """Create a MSVSProject object for the targets found in target list.
01795 
01796   Arguments:
01797     target_list: the list of targets to generate project objects for.
01798     target_dicts: the dictionary of specifications.
01799     options: global generator options.
01800     msvs_version: the MSVSVersion object.
01801   Returns:
01802     A set of created projects, keyed by target.
01803   """
01804   global fixpath_prefix
01805   # Generate each project.
01806   projects = {}
01807   for qualified_target in target_list:
01808     spec = target_dicts[qualified_target]
01809     if spec['toolset'] != 'target':
01810       raise GypError(
01811           'Multiple toolsets not supported in msvs build (target %s)' %
01812           qualified_target)
01813     proj_path, fixpath_prefix = _GetPathOfProject(qualified_target, spec,
01814                                                   options, msvs_version)
01815     guid = _GetGuidOfProject(proj_path, spec)
01816     overrides = _GetPlatformOverridesOfProject(spec)
01817     build_file = gyp.common.BuildFile(qualified_target)
01818     # Create object for this project.
01819     obj = MSVSNew.MSVSProject(
01820         proj_path,
01821         name=spec['target_name'],
01822         guid=guid,
01823         spec=spec,
01824         build_file=build_file,
01825         config_platform_overrides=overrides,
01826         fixpath_prefix=fixpath_prefix)
01827     # Set project toolset if any (MS build only)
01828     if msvs_version.UsesVcxproj():
01829       obj.set_msbuild_toolset(
01830           _GetMsbuildToolsetOfProject(proj_path, spec, msvs_version))
01831     projects[qualified_target] = obj
01832   # Set all the dependencies, but not if we are using an external builder like
01833   # ninja
01834   for project in projects.values():
01835     if not project.spec.get('msvs_external_builder'):
01836       deps = project.spec.get('dependencies', [])
01837       deps = [projects[d] for d in deps]
01838       project.set_dependencies(deps)
01839   return projects
01840 
01841 
01842 def _InitNinjaFlavor(params, target_list, target_dicts):
01843   """Initialize targets for the ninja flavor.
01844 
01845   This sets up the necessary variables in the targets to generate msvs projects
01846   that use ninja as an external builder. The variables in the spec are only set
01847   if they have not been set. This allows individual specs to override the
01848   default values initialized here.
01849   Arguments:
01850     params: Params provided to the generator.
01851     target_list: List of target pairs: 'base/base.gyp:base'.
01852     target_dicts: Dict of target properties keyed on target pair.
01853   """
01854   for qualified_target in target_list:
01855     spec = target_dicts[qualified_target]
01856     if spec.get('msvs_external_builder'):
01857       # The spec explicitly defined an external builder, so don't change it.
01858       continue
01859 
01860     path_to_ninja = spec.get('msvs_path_to_ninja', 'ninja.exe')
01861 
01862     spec['msvs_external_builder'] = 'ninja'
01863     if not spec.get('msvs_external_builder_out_dir'):
01864       gyp_file, _, _ = gyp.common.ParseQualifiedTarget(qualified_target)
01865       gyp_dir = os.path.dirname(gyp_file)
01866       configuration = '$(Configuration)'
01867       if params.get('target_arch') == 'x64':
01868         configuration += '_x64'
01869       spec['msvs_external_builder_out_dir'] = os.path.join(
01870           gyp.common.RelativePath(params['options'].toplevel_dir, gyp_dir),
01871           ninja_generator.ComputeOutputDir(params),
01872           configuration)
01873     if not spec.get('msvs_external_builder_build_cmd'):
01874       spec['msvs_external_builder_build_cmd'] = [
01875         path_to_ninja,
01876         '-C',
01877         '$(OutDir)',
01878         '$(ProjectName)',
01879       ]
01880     if not spec.get('msvs_external_builder_clean_cmd'):
01881       spec['msvs_external_builder_clean_cmd'] = [
01882         path_to_ninja,
01883         '-C',
01884         '$(OutDir)',
01885         '-tclean',
01886         '$(ProjectName)',
01887       ]
01888 
01889 
01890 def CalculateVariables(default_variables, params):
01891   """Generated variables that require params to be known."""
01892 
01893   generator_flags = params.get('generator_flags', {})
01894 
01895   # Select project file format version (if unset, default to auto detecting).
01896   msvs_version = MSVSVersion.SelectVisualStudioVersion(
01897       generator_flags.get('msvs_version', 'auto'))
01898   # Stash msvs_version for later (so we don't have to probe the system twice).
01899   params['msvs_version'] = msvs_version
01900 
01901   # Set a variable so conditions can be based on msvs_version.
01902   default_variables['MSVS_VERSION'] = msvs_version.ShortName()
01903 
01904   # To determine processor word size on Windows, in addition to checking
01905   # PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE (which reflects the word size of the current
01906   # process), it is also necessary to check PROCESSOR_ARCITEW6432 (which
01907   # contains the actual word size of the system when running thru WOW64).
01908   if (os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE', '').find('64') >= 0 or
01909       os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITEW6432', '').find('64') >= 0):
01910     default_variables['MSVS_OS_BITS'] = 64
01911   else:
01912     default_variables['MSVS_OS_BITS'] = 32
01913 
01914   if gyp.common.GetFlavor(params) == 'ninja':
01915     default_variables['SHARED_INTERMEDIATE_DIR'] = '$(OutDir)gen'
01916
